name: Peru
partner: Andrés Bello Foundation – Latin American Chinese Research Center
takeaway: It is more than evident that China's influence in Peru is strong through foreign policy, economy and society. However, the economic aspect is most critical when it comes to China's influence in Peru.

In the last 15 years, China has positioned itself economically in Peru via the Free Trade Agreement between both countries. This has allowed China to be the owner of the main copper producing mine in the country, to build the future main port terminal in South America at Chancay, and to own companies in charge of the generation and distribution of electrical energy. All this is due to the positive foreign policy that Peru has towards the PRC.

Chinese migration to Peru has contributed in cultural, economic and social aspects, earning a reputation as among the most Chinese countries in Latin America, as mentioned by journalist Patricia Castro Obando. This is reflected in the contributions to Peruvian gastronomy through the famous Chifa culinary tradition, and the entrepreneurship of Erasmo Wong Chiang in founding the Metro and Wong supermarkets, the most important in the country.
description-1: In 2023, Peru had a GDP per capita of US$6,692 and a total population of 34.35 million people.
description-2: Peru established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1971. Peru was ranked 125th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 66/100.

Academia.evidence:
"During the last two years (2023), various public and private universities have signed agreements to promote technological development. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating.
These signed agreements tend to be replicated by other universities that do not have this type of agreement. It is not ruled out that in the coming years, more universities will sign agreements with Chinese technology companies. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Significant” rating."
Academia.note: Currently Huawei is the Chinese technology company that has signed the most agreements with public and private universities in Peru. Among the universities that have established an agreement with Huawei are: National Engineering Universities (UNI), National University of the Altiplano (UNAP), Cesar Vallejo University (UCV), Federico Villarreal University (UFV), San Martín de Porres University (USMP) , Scientific University of the South (UCSUR) and Universidad Mayor de San Marcos (UNMSM).
